requirements.text: Fix the infinite loading state in ActorLoadingGuard: ensure the backend actor initialization completes successfully and does not hang indefinitely. Add a timeout mechanism (e.g., 15 seconds) after which the guard transitions to an error/retry state instead of spinning forever.

acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer hangs on the loading spinner indefinitely
If actor initialization exceeds 15 seconds, an error message and retry button are shown
On successful initialization, the app renders normally without a loading state

requirements.text: Ensure the 'Go Live' / 'End Live' admin button in Header.tsx is visible and functional for authenticated admin users. The button should correctly call the backend toggleLiveStatus (or equivalent) function and reflect the current live state after toggling.

quotes: go live option is now visible and working

acceptanceCriteria: Authenticated admin users see the 'Go Live' button in the header
Clicking 'Go Live' calls the backend and updates the live status
The button label switches to 'End Live' when the broadcast is active
The button does not remain in a loading/disabled state after the toggle completes

requirements.text: Audit and fix the useActor hook and actor initialization flow to ensure the anonymous and authenticated actor instances are created without errors. Add error boundary handling so any actor creation failure surfaces a user-readable message rather than a silent infinite load.
acceptanceCriteria: Actor creation errors are caught and displayed to the user
The app does not silently hang when the actor fails to initialize
A 'Retry' button is available when actor initialization fails

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
All Motoko logic must remain in backend/main.mo
nonGoals: Do not change the backend data model or existing API methods
Do not introduce new pages or features unrelated to the loading and Go Live fix
